Package gui

Class BattleScreen

java.lang.Object
gui.BattleScreen
public class BattleScreen extends Object
The screen that contains the battle.
Author:
Celia Allen, Bede Nathan

  • Constructor Details

    • BattleScreen

      public BattleScreen(GameEnvironment gameManager, Battle selectedBattle)
      Constructor for the class BattleScreen. Sets the private variable gameEnvironment to the gameManager given, calls the initialize() method, and sets the frame to visible. Sets the private variables player, day, and monstersToFight, all through the GameEnvironment class. Sets the private variable team to the player's team, using the setTeam() method.
      Parameters:
      gameManager - , of type GameEnvironment. The game manager.
      selectedBattle - , of type Battle. The current Battle being fought.

  • Method Details

    • closeWindow

      public void closeWindow()
      Closes the frame frmBattlescreen.

    • finishedWindow

      public void finishedWindow()
      Calls the GameEnvironment method closeBattleScreen, passing the BattleScreen object as a parameter.

    • getTeamBattle

      public ArrayList<Monster> getTeamBattle()
      Returns an ArrayList of the all the player's Monsters who are not stunned.
      Returns:
      team, of type ArrayList[Monster].

    • setTeam

      public void setTeam(ArrayList<Monster> team)
      Sets the private variable team. Return type void.
      Parameters:
      team - , of type ArrayList[Monster]. An ArrayList of the all the player's Monsters who are not stunned.

    • fight

      public void fight()
      Calls the method Battle.attack if both the player and game have monsters to fight. If not, it checks if the result was a draw, win, or loss for the player and displays the result to the user. Awards gold and points to the user if the battle was won, or a draw. Removes the fought Battle from the available battles. Calls launchMainScreen() and finishedWindow() to open the MainScreen and close the current window.

    • updateStatus

      public void updateStatus(String winner)
      Updates the private attribute team to contain no stunned Monsters. Return type void. Updates the status of the GUI, specifically the contents of textPaneFight, textAreaPlayer and textAreaGame.
      Parameters:
      winner - , of type String. A string representation of the Monster who won the most recent round of the Battle.

    • getCurrentTeam

      public ArrayList<Monster> getCurrentTeam(ArrayList<Monster> actualTeam)
      Filters the player's actual team for the Monsters who are not stunned, and returns an ArrayList of those Monsters.
      Parameters:
      actualTeam - , of type ArrayList[Monster]. The player's actual team, including stunned Monsters.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of type Monster. All the player's Monsters who are not stunned.
